documentation.xhtml:p: retriggerable edge triggered pulse similar to TP but with a retrigger nfunction
clk_prg uses the internal sps time to generate a clock with programmable period time.the period time is defined for 10ms .. 65s
this signal generator generates a square wave output

ST.xhtml:p: SIGN_R := in < 0.0; (* from OSCAT library; www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: this function return true if the real input is negative
This is a rounding function which returns the biggest possible integer which is less or equal to X. floor2(3.14) = 3 floor2(-3.14) = -4
modulo funtion for real numbers modr(5.5,2.5) = 0.5

d_trunc truncates a real to a dint 1.5 will be 1 and -1.5 will be -1 d_trunc is necessary because many systems do not offer a trunc to a dint also real_to_dint will not deliver the same result on different systems
this function returns the fraction of a real number fract(3.14) = 0.14

ST.xhtml:p:
BIT_OF_DWORD := (SHR(in,N) AND 16#00000001) > 0;
(* From Oscat Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: this function extracts a single bit from the nth position from right (right is lowest bit the lowest Bit (Bit0 from in) is selected with N=.
this function calculates a pseudo random number
this function loads a bit into a DWord at position pos
BIT_COUNT counts the amount True of bits in a dword.
trend_DW analyses the trend of a input signal.
Output current execution time in miliseconds
this ramp generator generates a byte wide ramp with 255 steps the generator has an asynchronous set and reset
_RMP_B generates a ramp on an external var of type byte
this function calculates a ramp and limits the output to 0 .. 255 without overflow problems
_RMP_NEXT will generate a ramp output following the input IN.
_RMP_B generates a ramp on an external var of type byte

ST.xhtml:p:
_WORD_TO_DINT := UINT_TO_DINT(WORD_TO_UINT(IN));
(* From OSCAT Library, www.oscat.de *)

documentation.xhtml:p: GEN_PULSE uses the internal sps timer to generate a continuous output waveform with programmable high and low time.
GEN_PW2 generates a time TH? followed by a time TL?.
this signal generator generates a random output. The signal is defined by period time (PT), amplitude (AM), offset (OS
RDMT generates a defined pulse with pulse width TP_Q at random times.
this signal generator generates a ramp wave output. The ramp wave signal is defined by period time (PT),
this signal generator generates a sine wave output
this signal generator generates a square wave signal which is specified by the frequency and the duty cycle
this signal generator generates a square wave signal which is specified by the frequency and the pulse width
this soft on/off ramp generator generates a soft on and soft off ramp while the max on value is set by the input
this ramp generator generates a Word wide ramp with 65535 steps
